histogram.name: PersistentCache.BackendInitialize.{BackendType}.{Mode}
histogram.summary:
Time it took to initialize a {BackendType} backend in {Mode} mode. Recorded every time a backend is successfully initialized.
Note: This metric is dropped for clients without high-precision clocks.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.Find.{BackendType}.{Mode}
histogram.summary:
Time it took to attempt to find an entry in a {BackendType} backend in {Mode} mode. Recorded for one out of every 100 operations.
Note: This metric is dropped for clients without high-precision clocks.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.Insert.{BackendType}.{Mode}
histogram.summary:
Time it took to attempt to insert an entry into a {BackendType} backend in {Mode} mode. Recorded for one out of every 100 operations.
Note: This metric is dropped for clients without high-precision clocks.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.ParamsManager.FilenameCharactersOverLimit
histogram.summary: Logs how many characters over the OS defined limit the path of a backing file was after it was calculated. Logged when file creation fails and the path is too long.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.ParamsManager.{FileType}.DeleteSuccess
histogram.summary:
Whether BackendParams manager succeeded in deleting a {FileType}.
Logged every time there is an attempt to delete a {FileType}.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.SandboxedFile.LockStateOnAbandon
histogram.summary: The state of the shared atomic lock at the moment a file is abandoned. The lock being held on abandonment either causes loss of entries or copying overhead. This is not expected to be a common case and this metric should be monitored as such. Logged each time a file is abandoned.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.Sqlite.LockError
histogram.summary: Reports the error recevied when locking a PersistentCache's primary database file when opened for use by only a single connection.

histogram.name: PersistentCache.Sqlite.{FileType}.{Operation}
histogram.summary: Reports the error recevied when {Operation} a PersistentCache's {FileType}.
